page.title: 17Buildings in the Study Area
page.content: There are about 107 houses in Ashbury, 20 in Idstone and 166 in Bishopstone and we found that most houses are brick built with a tiled roof .However old houses are built of chalk and sarsen with a thatch roof . The chalk and sarsen stones were found locally . Sarsen was used for foundations and lower walls because it did not let water in and did not crumble like chalk .The edge of chalk walls was often finished with red bricks especially round the windows.In Bishopstone we noticed that many of the thatch houses have a pebble dash cover to the chalk stone .It is possible to see beams in the walls of one or two old thatch houses . .Some of the older brick houses were roofed with slate . Newer brick houses are often cement rendered or painted and have tiles on the roof .
